title: A Case of Autoimmune Acute Disseminated Encephalomyelitis in an Adult Female with Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
content: Acute disseminated encephalomyelitis (ADEM) is an inflammatory demyelinating disorder of the white matter. Pathophysiology is thought to be immune mediated as in most cases the condition follows an infection or triggering incident. More recent literature has demonstrated that there may be a link between autoimmune conditions and ADEM. Here we present a case of ADEM in a middle-aged woman with systemic lupus erythematosus that recovered well after treatment with corticosteroids and Rituximab.
